origin: Middle English a variant of travail, and originally in the same sense.

definitions.definition: Go from one place to another, typically over a distance of some length.
definitions.example: the vessel had been traveling from Libya to Ireland

definitions.definition: (of an object or radiation) move, typically in a constant or predictable way.
Take more than the allowed number of steps (typically two) while holding the ball without dribbling it.

definitions.example: my job involves a lot of travel

definitions.definition: The range, rate, or mode of motion of a part of a machine.
